- Staphylococcus aureus: 80-90% susceptible to methicillin (=SAMS)

- 30% of the general population are healthy carriers of S. aureus (nose, armpits, perineum)

- Serious infection because :

*Frequent septic metastases
*Frequent foreign material (source of bacteremia or secondary graft)
*Associated with endocarditis in 10% of cases: echocardiography must be performed systematically
*High risk of septic shock

- The route of entry is cutaneous. It is not found in 30% of cases.

question.title: What is a common source of Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia in adults and children?
question.description: The route of entry of Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia

option_a.title: Frequent septic metastases
option_a.description: A serious complication of Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia

option_b.title: The nose, armpits, and perineum
option_b.description: Common sites where Staphylococcus aureus is commonly found

option_c.title: Foreign material (e.g. grafts, medical devices)
option_c.description: A common source of Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia

option_d.title: Endocarditis in 10% of cases
option_d.description: A complication of Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia

correct_option.title: The nose, armpits, and perineum
correct_option.description: A common source of Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia
